keyMoments.title: Robin Reveals She Can Read Poneglyphs
keyMoments.description: In a moment of desperation after seeing Clover shot, young Robin reveals to Spandine and the World Government that she too can read the Poneglyphs, inadvertently sealing her fate as a fugitive.
keyMoments.significance: This revelation marks the beginning of Robin's 20-year life as a hunted criminal and explains why the World Government has pursued her relentlessly.
keyMoments.quote: I can read them too! I can read the Poneglyphs!

keyMoments.title: Robin Reunites with Her Mother
keyMoments.description: After Robin reveals she can read Poneglyphs, Olvia can no longer deny their relationship. Mother and daughter embrace and cry together, reuniting for the first time in years.
keyMoments.significance: The emotional core of the Ohara flashback, showing the tragic reunion between Robin and her mother just before they must part forever.

keyMoments.title: Saul Carries Robin Away
keyMoments.description: As the Tree of Knowledge burns, Saul picks up young Robin and begins to carry her away, with Robin crying and reaching back toward her mother as they flee.
keyMoments.significance: The final separation of Robin from her mother and her home, marking the beginning of Robin's journey as the last survivor of Ohara's scholars.

relationships.description: Robin reunites with her mother Olvia during the Buster Call on Ohara, sharing a brief emotional reunion before being separated forever.

evolutionMoments.description: Robin and Olvia embrace and cry together after Robin reveals she can read Poneglyphs, reuniting emotionally before Olvia sends her away with Saul.

relationships.description: Saul carries Robin away from Ohara at Olvia's request, becoming her protector.

evolutionMoments.description: Olvia entrusts Robin to Saul's care, and he carries her away from the burning Tree of Knowledge to save her life.

reveals.information: Robin publicly reveals to the World Government that she can read the Poneglyphs

keyMoments.title: Olvia Reunites with Robin
keyMoments.description: After Robin reveals she can read Poneglyphs, Olvia can no longer deny their relationship and embraces her daughter emotionally.
keyMoments.significance: The tragic reunion between mother and daughter just before they must part forever.

keyMoments.title: Olvia Explains the Scholar's Mission
keyMoments.description: Olvia explains to Robin that being a scholar means hearing the voices of the past and passing history on to the future, emphasizing that the scholars never wanted to use the forbidden knowledge.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Robin's core motivation and her eventual role as the person who will carry on Ohara's will to preserve and reveal the true history.
keyMoments.quote: History must be passed on. We never wanted to use this knowledge... only to hear the voices of the past and pass them to the future.

keyMoments.title: Olvia Entrusts Robin to Saul
keyMoments.description: Olvia makes the painful decision to send Robin away with Saul while she stays behind to help save the books and face her fate with her fellow scholars.
keyMoments.significance: Olvia's ultimate sacrifice as a mother, choosing to ensure Robin's survival while accepting her own death.
keyMoments.quote: Saul... please protect Robin. Get her off this island!

relationships.description: Olvia is Robin's mother who reunites with her daughter during the Buster Call on Ohara before sacrificing herself.

evolutionMoments.description: Olvia embraces Robin emotionally and explains the scholars' mission before entrusting her to Saul and sending her away to survive.

keyMoments.title: Clover Reveals Ancient Kingdom Theory
keyMoments.description: Professor Clover reveals to the Five Elders that the Poneglyphs were created by an ancient civilization to preserve their history from being erased by the World Government's predecessors.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most important Void Century revelations in the series, establishing that the World Government has been actively suppressing history.
keyMoments.quote: The Poneglyphs were most likely carved by an ancient country to prevent the World Government from completely erasing their history!

keyMoments.title: Professor Clover Shot by Spandine
keyMoments.description: As Professor Clover is about to reveal the name of the ancient kingdom, Spandine shoots him on orders from the Five Elders.
keyMoments.significance: The World Government silences one of the world's greatest scholars to prevent the truth about the Void Century from being revealed.

keyMoments.title: Clover Leads Effort to Save Books
keyMoments.description: Despite being mortally wounded, Professor Clover leads the scholars in throwing books into the lake to preserve Ohara's knowledge.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the scholars' dedication to preserving knowledge even in the face of death.
keyMoments.quote: We must pass on this history! Throw the books into the lake!

reveals.information: The Poneglyphs were created by an ancient civilization to prevent the World Government from erasing their history
Professor Clover's full name is revealed to be Clou D. Clover, revealing he is a member of the D. clan

keyMoments.title: Spandine Shoots Professor Clover
keyMoments.description: Following orders from the Five Elders, Spandine shoots Professor Clover to silence him before he can reveal the name of the ancient kingdom.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Spandine's role as the World Government's executioner and his willingness to commit murder to suppress the truth.

keyMoments.title: Spandine Activates the Buster Call
keyMoments.description: Spandine activates the Golden Den Den Mushi, summoning the Buster Call to completely destroy Ohara.
keyMoments.significance: Initiates one of the most tragic events in One Piece history, demonstrating the World Government's extreme measures to protect its secrets.

name.japanese: ハグワール・D・サウロ

keyMoments.title: Saul Accepts Responsibility for Robin
keyMoments.description: Saul accepts Olvia's request to protect Robin and get her off the island, taking on the role of her protector.
keyMoments.significance: Saul becomes the guardian who will save Robin and allow her to survive the Buster Call.

keyMoments.title: Saul Carries Robin Away
keyMoments.description: Saul picks up young Robin and begins to carry her away from the burning Tree of Knowledge.
keyMoments.significance: Begins Robin's escape from Ohara under Saul's protection.

relationships.description: Saul becomes Robin's protector, accepting Olvia's request to save her daughter from the Buster Call.

evolutionMoments.description: Olvia entrusts Robin to Saul, and he carries her away from Ohara to save her life.
